qas.question: How often do birds groom their feathers?
What percentage of their day do birds groom their feathers?
What do birds use to brush away foreign particles?
What is the process of removing feather parasites?

context: Feathers require maintenance and birds preen or groom them <a0_0>daily<a0_0/>, spending an average of around <a1_0>9%<a1_0/> of their daily time on this. <a2_0>The bill<a2_0/> is used to brush away foreign particles and to apply waxy secretions from the uropygial gland; these secretions protect the feathers' flexibility and act as an antimicrobial agent, inhibiting the growth of feather-degrading bacteria. This may be supplemented with the secretions of formic acid from ants, which birds receive through a behaviour known as <a3_0>anting<a3_0/>, to remove feather parasites.
